trans-unit.source: Use bcp to load data into SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use bcp to load data into SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn what bcp is and how to use it for data warehousing scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Learn what bcp is and how to use it for data warehousing scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Load data with bcp
trans-unit.target: Load data with bcp

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>bcp[]</linkText><title></title></link>** is a command-line bulk load utility that allows you to copy data between SQL Server, data files, and SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>bcp[]</linkText><title></title></link>** is a command-line bulk load utility that allows you to copy data between SQL Server, data files, and SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Use bcp to import large numbers of rows into SQL Data Warehouse tables or to export data from SQL Server tables into data files.
trans-unit.target: Use bcp to import large numbers of rows into SQL Data Warehouse tables or to export data from SQL Server tables into data files.

trans-unit.source: Except when used with the queryout option, bcp requires no knowledge of Transact-SQL.
trans-unit.target: Except when used with the queryout option, bcp requires no knowledge of Transact-SQL.

trans-unit.source: bcp is a quick and easy way to move smaller data sets into and out of a SQL Data Warehouse database.
trans-unit.target: bcp is a quick and easy way to move smaller data sets into and out of a SQL Data Warehouse database.

trans-unit.source: The exact amount of data that is recommended to load/extract via bcp will depend on you network connection to the Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: The exact amount of data that is recommended to load/extract via bcp will depend on you network connection to the Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: Generally, dimension tables can be loaded and extracted but fairly large fact tables may take a significant amount of time to load or extract from.
trans-unit.target: Generally, dimension tables can be loaded and extracted but fairly large fact tables may take a significant amount of time to load or extract from.

trans-unit.source: With bcp you can:
trans-unit.target: With bcp you can:

trans-unit.source: Use a simple command-line utility to load data into SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Use a simple command-line utility to load data into SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Use a simple command-line utility to extract data from SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Use a simple command-line utility to extract data from SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will show you how to:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will show you how to:

trans-unit.source: Import data into a table using the bcp in command
trans-unit.target: Import data into a table using the bcp in command

trans-unit.source: Export data from a table uisng the bcp out command
trans-unit.target: Export data from a table uisng the bcp out command

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To step through this tutorial, you need:
trans-unit.target: To step through this tutorial, you need:

trans-unit.source: A SQL Data Warehouse database
trans-unit.target: A SQL Data Warehouse database

trans-unit.source: The bcp command line utility installed
trans-unit.target: The bcp command line utility installed

trans-unit.source: The SQLCMD command ine utility installed
trans-unit.target: The SQLCMD command ine utility installed

trans-unit.source: You can download the bcp and sqlcmd utilities from the <link><linkText>Microsoft Download Center[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can download the bcp and sqlcmd utilities from the <link><linkText>Microsoft Download Center[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Import data into SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Import data into SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create a table in Azure SQL Data Warehouse and import data into the table.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create a table in Azure SQL Data Warehouse and import data into the table.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a table in Azure SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a table in Azure SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: From a command prompt, connect to your instance using the following command replacing the values as appropriate:
trans-unit.target: From a command prompt, connect to your instance using the following command replacing the values as appropriate:

trans-unit.source: Once connected, copy the following table script at the sqlcmd prompt and then press the Enter key:
trans-unit.target: Once connected, copy the following table script at the sqlcmd prompt and then press the Enter key:

trans-unit.source: On the next line, enter the GO batch terminator and then press the Enter key to execute the statement:
trans-unit.target: On the next line, enter the GO batch terminator and then press the Enter key to execute the statement:

trans-unit.source: bcp DimDate2 in C:\Temp\DimDate2.txt -S <html></html> -d <html></html> -U <html></html> -P <html></html> -q -c -t ','
trans-unit.target: bcp DimDate2 in C:\Temp\DimDate2.txt -S <html></html> -d <html></html> -U <html></html> -P <html></html> -q -c -t ','

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM DimDate2 ORDER BY 1;
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM DimDate2 ORDER BY 1;

trans-unit.source: GO
trans-unit.target: GO

trans-unit.source: bcp DimDate2 out C:\Temp\DimDate2_export.txt -S <html></html> -d <html></html> -U <html></html> -P <html></html> -q -c -t ','
trans-unit.target: bcp DimDate2 out C:\Temp\DimDate2_export.txt -S <html></html> -d <html></html> -U <html></html> -P <html></html> -q -c -t ','

trans-unit.source: Due to the nature of distributed systems, the data order may not be the same across SQL Data Warehouse databases.
trans-unit.target: Due to the nature of distributed systems, the data order may not be the same across SQL Data Warehouse databases.

trans-unit.source: You could optionally use the queryout parameter to specify which Transact-SQL query to run.
trans-unit.target: You could optionally use the queryout parameter to specify which Transact-SQL query to run.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
